Articles.Content:
Hi, I am trying to make an invitation to send to some friends. It will look a little bit like this

Is it possible to solve it or is it too hard?

EDIT: If you tried and got stuck, please tell me!

Thanks

Kamik423

(Yes I got a typewriter for this)

Edited September 11, 2015 by Kamik423
well they should figure it out easily but having the way to uncode it is kinda boring you should have it in binary on the back or something like that

so you figured it out! Thanks for being the first to provide any feedback!

you can uncode it with just one magic little line of python

print bin(int('448820E....0002',16))

Ach, ve haf ze formula, und zey put it on zis forum!!! Ach und himmel!!! Now ve haf zee secret to unlimited power.

Nuzzink can shtop us now!!!

(With apologies to any Germans on this forum... I myself am Dutch so as the two languages are similar, I insulted myself as well...)

P.S. Its hard to type in a funny accent... ever notice that?
Actually if you're friends know any coding at all they don't need the answers on the side because it is kinda obvious
thanks for the feedback. I was kinda worried that it would be too hard and unsolveable
I know of no online tool that can handle this long hexadecimal numbers, if thats what you mean, but you could run the python code here
